active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the statement: 'Delivery inspection procedures are more critical for physical threats (e.g., explosives) than cyber risks (e.g., malware insertion) in loading areas.' Use NIST SP 800-161 controls (SI-7, SI-20) and real-world examples like the SolarWinds supply chain attack to support your arguments, considering prerequisites from Personnel Security and Guard Operations.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Distractor 1: Common misconception (e.g., 'Skip visual checks if seal intact' – ignores tampering post-seal).
Distractor 2: Related but incorrect concept (e.g., confuse SI-7 with SI-20: 'SI-7 prioritizes risks' – no, SI-20 does).
Distractor 3: Extreme/overly simplistic (e.g., 'X-ray all packages' – impractical; or 'Ignore physical threats' – ignores subdomain).
Ensure plausibility: Base on voter priorities (e.g., incomplete controls), real threats (counterfeit vs. genuine), Bloom progression.
